title: Justin Bieber appears in a bizarre Japanese commercial
text: Share this article Share Sporting traditional blue Japanese clothing, Justin tries his hand at Japanese, saying 'Konnichiwa' before taking a selfie on a phone before going into a school. He walks through the corridors with a gaggle of schoolchildren behind him then pops his head into a class that Piko Taro appears to be teaching. Pineapple and a pen: Piko attempts to take Justin through his song Closer: On the blackboard behind them, the lyrics to Piko’s hit song can be seen Striding through the corridors: A gaggle of Japanese schoolchildren are seen behind Justin The pair greet each other then work together to teach the children before Justin gives all the pupils a high five. Justin and Piko have a longstanding bromance going on. Last August, Piko released a bizarre song, 'Pen-Pineapple-Apple-Pen' and finding it funny, Justin shared a clip of the hit on Twitter to his 90 million followers. Selfie time! Justin took snaps of himself at the beginning of the commercial for the phone company He's eccentric! Justin was decked out in a traditional Japanese ensemble while Piko wore a pencil moustache, glasses and his favourite leopardprint outfit Candid camera: The teaser clip of the commercial showed Justin being filmed in some behind-the-scenes action The advert allowed the pair to finally meet in person, and it even has a reference to the song with the pair using a pineapple and an apple in the classroom to teach the children. On the blackboard behind them, the lyrics to Piko’s hit song can be seen. The advert for the Softbank phone company is to provide a discounted plan for students between the ages of 18 and 25. Commercial value: Justin also recently appeared in Super Bowl advert for T-Mobile Excited: Justin appeared a little bemused but appeared to enjoy his appearance Justin recently took part in a Super Bowl commercial for T-Mobile where he give a history of touchdown celebrations decked out in a tuxedo. To illustrate the 'high five,' the star turns back to a scene behind him - which is professional football player and New England Patriots tight end Rob 'Gronk' Gronkowski dressed as a caveman and giving a high five. The advert came to prominence at the weekend when Wyoming police threatened to punish drink drivers who decide to get behind the wheel intoxicated with being subjected to 'that Justin Bieber @TMobile Super Bowl Commercial the entire way to jail,' Big fan: Justin retweeted a link to Piko Taro's PPAP song last year, describing it as 'the funnies video on the Internet' Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
